wikitext.*:
'''''fae''''' is [[Sindarin]] for "spirit".<ref>{{MR|P3I3}}, p. 165</ref>
==Cognates==
*[[Quenya]] ''[[fëa]]''
:Tolkien mentions that the name ''[[Fëanor]]'' is a Sindarinized version of the Quenya ''[[Fëanáro]]'',<ref>{{MR|P3II3a}}, p. 217</ref> so is not proper Sindarin. His genuine Sindarin name would be ''Faenor'' instead.<ref>{{PM|Shibboleth}}, p. 343</ref>

==Inspiration==
'''[[Wiktionary:fae|Fae]]''' is an archaic English word referring to "magic" or "[[fairies]]". This word was used by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] in the early version of his [[legendarium]] (''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'') to refer to the [[Valar]] and the [[Elves]].
